articles.author: Timour Azhari, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel bombarded the Gaza Strip and Beirut's southern suburbs on Friday, a day after U.S. envoys made a renewed but so far fruitless diplomatic push to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, Gaza after U.S. truce push

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea flexed its military muscle with the test of a huge new solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile dubbed Hwasong-19, state media said on Friday, amid international uproar over its troops deployed to aid Russia in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea says record test was new Hwasong-19 intercontinental ballistic missile

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran’s leadership and allies are bracing for what they would regard as a dreadful outcome of the imminent U.S. presidential election: A return to power of Donald Trump.
articles.title: Iran braces for Trump victory, fearing more Israeli strikes, Western sanctions

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: For many Ukrainians, the outcome of the U.S. election next week and its impact on the war with Russia feels less likely to be pivotal than it once did.
articles.title: In Ukraine, hopes of war breakthrough slim whoever wins US election

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: U.S. data and polling firm Edison Research said on Friday the differences between its exit poll of Georgia's parliamentary election and the official results pointed to "manipulation" of the vote, becoming the second such pollster to do so.
articles.title: US pollster Edison says Georgia election results suggest 'manipulation'

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Laila Bassam
articles.description: A U.S. official asked Lebanon to declare a unilateral ceasefire with Israel to revive stalled talks to end Israeli-Hezbollah hostilities, a senior Lebanese political source and a senior diplomat said - a claim denied by both sides.
articles.title: US asked Lebanon to declare unilateral truce with Israel, sources say; both sides deny it

articles.author: Nacho Doce, Eva Manez
articles.description: Some came armed with mops and buckets, pick-axes or shovels, others carried bottles of drinking water and bags of food.
articles.title: Volunteers bring ray of light to Spanish towns shattered by floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kamal Kharrazi, an adviser to Iran's supreme leader, said on Friday that Tehran is likely to increase the range of its ballistic missiles and possibly review its nuclear doctrine, amid growing tensions with arch-enemy Israel and tit-for-tat missile and airstrikes.
articles.title: Iran adviser hints at expansion of missile range, nuclear doctrine review after Israel strikes

articles.author: Macdonald Dzirutwe
articles.description: Nigeria faces one of its worst hunger crises with more than 30 million people expected to be food insecure next year, a one third jump from this year due to economic hardship, a joint report by the government and United Nations said on Friday.
articles.title: Nigeria's hunger crisis deepens with 33 million at risk, report says

articles.author: A.J. Vicens
articles.description: They're not taking any chances this time, said Sara Cutter.
articles.title: Staff at US voting machine firms prep for doxxing, misinformation and 'swatting'
